item.description:
Maybe I wasn't emphatic enough below...

This is a Great Hike! For a very short climb, we get some of the most amazing views. And the waterfalls on the way back are like a fairy wonderland of cascading crystal streams. And then there's the PUB! There's always a pub, of course but this one is in a backwater NH town where you might not expect to find much of anything. And they're always so friendly you'll feel like you had grown up there and the waitress knows your mom and you went to high school with the bartender - maybe even dated him for a short time in that crazy period you had in the summer after 11th grade when you hitchhiked to the Peter Frampton and/or Cheap Trick concert...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This is a really nice hike.

Our route along Shannon Brook will bring us past coursing streams and crystal waterfalls. We'll hike to a granite ledge lookout point with views across Lake Winnipesaukee and out to the Belknap Range. We'll pass through the grounds of Castle in the Clouds, an Arts & Crafts-style estate owned by the Lakes Region Conservation Trust.

Trails vary from wide & flat to rocky & steep but this hike will be mostly easy with a few short steeper sections - and the views are incredible! We should be on the trail for about 3 or 4 hours. Bring something to eat for the hike but...

 We'll stop at Poor People's Pub on the way home. It's a very friendly place we found after a snowshoe a few years ago. The food is good and the service even better. It's located on RT 109 in Sanbornville half a mile east of Rt 16.

CARPOOL: 11:00 AM @ Dover CJ Trailways Park & Ride Spaulding Tpk north to Exit 9 - Left @ light - then Left @ 2nd light. Please share expenses with your driver.

Trailhead: Follow Rt 16 north to Rt 171 (~36mi from Dover exit 9). Turn LEFT & follow Rt 171 for exactly 12.5 miles from Rt 16. The Shannon Brook Trail parking area is on the left, just before the intersection w/ Severance Rd in Moultonborough, NH. Drive time from Dover is ~65 minutes.

Bring Microspikes or some sort of foot traction! If you don't have them, go to EMS, REI, KTP, LLBean or some other initialed store and buy spikes that look like the picture below. Failing that, use two poles, but don't slip and fall! Rain or shine. No Pets.

The Ossipee Mountain range is a 9-mile wide circular wilderness that rises 2000'-3000' directly above Lake Winnipesaukee. Views of the lake, the White Mountains, and the surrounding countryside are absolutely breathtaking.The isolated and undeveloped mass of the Ossipee range is the largest and least disturbed wildlife habitat in the region. The range is 9 miles in diameter, its tallest summit rising to an elevation of 2,975 feet. The Ossipees consist of a circular land mass of more than 40,000 acres, accessed by only three interior roads, none of which bisect the area.

There are 25 named mountains and dozens of unnamed summits within the range; 16 named brooks originate in the Ossipees, while scores of smaller watercourses create ravines within its borders. The biodiversity of this land has been largely unaffected by human hands, to the great benefit and proliferation of the species inside its borders. Old growth trees dating back to the 1590’s have been discovered, and more than a score of species deemed endangered or threatened on a statewide to global scale have been identified.

Liability Release

You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.name: Shannon Waterfalls, Ossipee Views, & Poor People's Brews
